Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior: glazed black; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; below, two bands above billet and square band in red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of possible sphinx (rump remaining) seated to left; below, trace of undetermined motif; reserved cul.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 94)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1598) (phase 2)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 577) (Incorrectly labelled UCL 767)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL np 60 (Other Accession Number)
